Description: Rim fragment of neck of Attic black-figure painted pottery neck-amphora. Doubled lotus and palmette chain. Narrow purple bands on lip - one at outer and one at inner edge of top, and one diverging to make two at middle of outer face. Modern graffito inside.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (C), chamber 19 A, bench on west side
Curator's comments: Findspot number '19A W' scratched on the item.
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 609, 7)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 73)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.208)
